trans-unit.target:
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_SEQ_00<tab>Seigetsu the Enlightened has concerns of an equestrian nature.
※Please note that the difficulty of this quest has been synced to your current level. Furthermore, you may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_TODO_00<tab>Find the Namazu horse enthusiast in Nhaama's Retreat.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_TODO_01<tab>Mount the horse, and ride it to the Mol horse handler.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_TODO_02<tab>Report to Seigetsu the Enlightened.

TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_KOFUINSEIGETSU_000_000<tab>A fellow festival enthusiast volunteered to return one of the horses the Mol so graciously provided for our racing event, but I fear his “enthusiasm” is rather greater than his horsemanship...
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_KOFUINSEIGETSU_000_001<tab>To be perfectly blunt, he is an atrocious equestrian, and there is a distinct possibility that either he or the mount will be injured.

TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_KOFUINSEIGETSU_000_002<tab>I would greatly appreciate it if you could find our would-be horse wrangler, and ensure the bodily integrity of both parties. Pray begin your search on the outskirts of Dhoro Iloh─I consider it <var 1A 02 /var>extremely<var 1A 01 /var> unlikely he has managed to travel more than a few dozen yalms beyond the Towering Still.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_010<tab>The Mol make it look so easy. Effortless. I thought I could just leap on its back, and gallop off across the steppe. But, no. No, no, no...

TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_011<tab>I don't know if I nudged the wrong spot or what, but we were suddenly racing down the side of the cliff! My entire life flashed before my bulging eyes!
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_012<tab>Practice makes perfect, or so they say. ...They wouldn't say that if they saw my attempts at riding horses.

TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_013<tab>I did my best not to nudge the beast the wrong way, but once again I found myself hurtling down the cliffside at a breakneck pace. How fortunate that I have little neck to speak of, let alone break!
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_014<tab>It might be best if I retire before I steer myself into a Matanga lair...
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_015<tab>Please, would you ride the horse for me? Yes, yes?
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_016<tab>A Mol horse handler was to meet me halfway. “Just follow the course of the river to the north,” Seigetsu said. Sounds simple enough, doesn't it...?

TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYNAMAZUO03118_000_017<tab>Oh, hello. When I saw the horse return alone, I was worried you'd been snagged by one of those long-toothed cats. Well, our Mol friend will be waiting, so it's back in the saddle for you! So to speak.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYMOL03118_000_018<tab>Do those stunted creatures even know how to ride...?
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_SYSTEM_000_019<tab>Speak with the Namazu horse enthusiast in Nhaama's Retreat to mount a horse, and then deliver the animal to the Mol horse handler.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYMOL03118_000_020<tab>...You are returning one of our horses? I expected a Namazu rider, but to be honest, I am somewhat relieved.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYMOL03118_000_021<tab>Hah, did you see it race away!? The poor beast must have been homesick for Mol Iloh!
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYMOL03118_000_022<tab>I thank you for returning our animal in fine health. Pray send my regards to Seigetsu and his kin.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_DAILYMOL03118_000_023<tab>The horse will find its way home, worry not. Feel free to make your own way back to the Namazu.
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_KOFUINSEIGETSU_000_030<tab><sigh> As expected, you were forced to salvage my shortsighted─and shortlimbed─kin's duty. I did try to dissuade him from his course...
TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_KOFUINSEIGETSU_000_031<tab>In any case, my perspicacity in assigning your tasks has been borne out once again.

TEXT_BANNAM504_03118_KOFUINSEIGETSU_000_032<tab>Unfortunately, however, our enthusiast's zeal is as unrelenting as my intellect, and he is surely doomed to repeat these ill-considered horseback disasters. In such an event, your assistance will once more be welcome.
